channel.title: Graphical calculator
channel.description:
For school we have to work with normal distributions, and I have TI-84 plus with which you can calculate this stuff. There is a function called normalcdf() and it works like this: normalcdf(Left boundary,Right boundary, Average, Standard deviation). So lets say I have this question:
Average: 2010.27 SD: 131.85 How much % is < 1906.22?
What would my left boundary be? 0 or something else? I used to know this, but I forgot.
Thanks in advance!

item.title: Graphical calculator
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Check the date, I already know the answer. And what you posted didn’t make any sense either.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphical calculator
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Life Java Is My Life™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Life wrote:

I’m sorry I really didn’t catch on what your doing here. Google ‘Graphicle Calculator’ OR If it’s a worksheet check for a link at the bottom of the page. If there’s a link you’re in luck, go to the link and answers should be there.

Read full topic
